greenmirror

Class FxShapeWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • greenmirror.FxWrapper
        • greenmirror.FxShapeWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CircleFxWrapper, RectangleFxWrapper, TextFxWrapper

    public abstract class FxShapeWrapper
extends FxWrapper
    A small extension of the FxWrapper class. It's meant to wrap Java FX nodes that are an instance of Shape.

    All JavaFX Shape nodes have a fill property, so this class adds it to the wrapper functionalities it inherits from FxWrapper.

    Author:
    Karim El Assal
    See Also:
    FxWrapper, Shape

      • setFill

        public @NonNull FxShapeWrapper setFill(javafx.scene.paint.Paint value)

        See Also:

      • setFill

        public @NonNull FxShapeWrapper setFill(@NonNull java.lang.String value)
        Sets the virtual fill of the JavaFX node and notifies the observer (the GreenMirror node, if this FxShapeWrapper is part of a GreenMirror node). It uses Paint.valueOf(value) to get the Paint value.

        Note that value should result in a Color type if the setting of the fill property will result in an animation: anything other than the Color subtype of Paint can not be animated.

        Parameters:
        value - the new fill
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if value can not be parsed by the Paint.valueOf(String) method
        See Also:
        setFill(Paint), Shape.setFill(Paint)

      • animateFill

        public @NonNull javafx.animation.FillTransition animateFill(@NonNull javafx.scene.paint.Paint value,
                                                            @NonNull javafx.util.Duration duration)
        Creates the animation that changes the fill property of the JavaFX node to value.

        value is first converted to type Color using Color.valueOf(value.toString()). There are some important remarks about why this is done to value available {here.

        Parameters:
        value - the fill value to change to
        duration - the duration of the animation
        Returns:
        the JavaFX Animation that animates the change
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if getFxNode() is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the 'to' or 'from' value can't be animated
        See Also:
        animateFill(Color, Duration), FillTransition, Color, Color.valueOf(String)

      • animateFill

        public @NonNull javafx.animation.FillTransition animateFill(@NonNull java.lang.String value,
                                                            @NonNull javafx.util.Duration duration)
        Creates the animation that changes the fill property of the JavaFX node to value.

        There are some important remarks about value available {here.

        Parameters:
        value - the fill value to change to
        duration - the duration of the animation
        Returns:
        the JavaFX Animation that animates the change
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if getFxNode() is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the 'to' or 'from' value can't be animated or value is an invalid color value
        See Also:
        animateFill(Color, Duration), FillTransition, Color, Color.valueOf(String)

      • animateFill

        public @NonNull javafx.animation.FillTransition animateFill(javafx.scene.paint.Color value,
                                                            @NonNull javafx.util.Duration duration)
        Creates the animation that changes the fill property of the JavaFX node to value.

        When animating a fill change, the 'from' and 'to' fill values must be of the Paint subtype Color. Any other subtypes can not be animated. If one tries to use any other Paint subtype for an animation, a IllegalArgumentException is thrown by the Color.valueOf(String) method.

        Parameters:
        value - the fill value to change to
        duration - the duration of the animation
        Returns:
        the JavaFX Animation that animates the change
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if getFxNode() is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the 'to' or 'from' value can't be animated
        See Also:
        FillTransition, Color, Color.valueOf(String)
